Transcript: W: Hi, Matthew. Q1 Any news on our sales results for last month?
M: I am just finishing the report now. Looks like our sales are booming in our Woodsdale stores, but the Collingwood stores aren’t doing well. Usually it’s the other way around.
W: Hmm... Q2 That’s interesting.
M: Q3 Maybe we need to take a trip to Collingwood and talk to the management team about why their sales changed so quickly.
W: Yep. Let’s go this afternoon.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
What does the woman imply when she says “That’s interesting”?
choices: (A) She wants to work at the Collingwood store.
(B) She knows their sales are down.
(C) She wasn’t listening to the man.
(D) She wants to know why the sales are down.

answer.text: (D) She wants to know why the sales are down.

answer.explanation:
W-Am: Hello, Mr. Whitman? This is Susan Wright, the editor of Mountain Ridge Magazine. Q1 I'm calling because I'd like you to write an article for our publication. We've seen previous articles you've written on rock climbing, and we're impressed with your work.
M-Au: I'm glad to hear that. I've been reading your magazine for many years, so I'm excited about the opportunity to write for you. Q2 Could you give me more details about the subject you want me to write about?
W-Am: We'd like you to review some rock-climbing equipment that's just come on the market. Q3 We'll send you the equipment you'll be reviewing. If possible, I'd like to have the review by the end of the month so we can include it in our August issue.

Transcript:
M: We finally were able to pump all of the water from the basement today. Unfortunately, a lot of our inventory was damaged by the water.
W: I’ve never seen a flood occur so fast like that. Because of the damaged inventory, we won’t be able to be open for a few days.
M: Well, at least it didn’t happen over the weekend when no one was in the office. The damage could have been much worse.
W: That’s true. I heard from our supplier and they said they can restock our storage room this Friday. I guess we’ll just have to wait patiently until then.

Transript:
M1: Hi Bob, hi Karen. The reason I called you in is to talk about the budget for the last two months. Q1 This biggest issue is that our entertainment expenses are way too high. I think we need to reduce the amount we are spending on company lunches and dinners.
W: Q2 Yes, I agree. I think we need to start paying for our own lunches.
M2: I agree with both of you, but I think we need to keep entertaining clients. I think if we pay for our own lunches, then that will leave money to take clients out for dinner.
M1: That’s a pretty good idea Bob. Karen, does that sound OK with you?
W: I think that’s a great compromise Bob. Q3 I will make a monthly budget plan and e-mail it to you this afternoon.

question.text: What is the main problem the speakers are discussing?
choices: (A) What they should eat for lunch

W-Am: Thanks for letting me know. Everyone at our office leaves around five-thirty, but Q2 the building security officer will be here all night. I’ll ask him to let you in.

W-Am: Actually, Q3 could you send it to me by e-mail? I think that would be better.

M: Hello, Ms. Turner. This is Michael Schmidt calling from the Yorkshire Seaside Hotel. It says here that you would like to be informed if a seaside room became available. Well, someone has just canceled, so if you would like to upgrade, you may.
W: Oh, great. Thanks so much for informing me. How much more is the upgraded room compared to the standard room?
M: Well, it will cost an extra $50 a night. However, the room comes with a larger bed and a hot tub. I recommend you visit our website to see pictures and information on the room.
W: OK. I’ll look at your website and then call you back with my decision.

Starting next month, Q1 the factory will be adding a Saturday shift to the schedule in order to meet holiday demand for our toys. Q2 If you'd like to earn some extra money by working more hours, please talk with your supervisor. Q3 The new schedule will start next month, so please let us know if you're interested by the end of the week.

answer.explanation: Hello, Mr. Dario. l’m calling from Leroy's Cake Shop about the cake you ordered. l'm really sorry but we've made a mistake. We used the wrong filling for the cake—instead of blueberries, we put raspberries in it. 73You have two choices. If you don't mind the different ingredients, we'll give you this cake for free. Or, if you still want the cake with blueberry filling, we'll offer you a thirty percent discount and bake you a new cake by tomorrow. Please let us know what you decide.

Transcript:
Before this meeting concludes, I would like to mention a new opportunity available to all employees. Q1 As a benefit of our recent merger with TechSoft Solutions, you can now expand your medical insurance to include vision and dental coverage. Q2 You can visit our company website to calculate exactly how much this change would increase your monthly payment. Q3 If you have never accessed our website in the past, you will first need to contact Suzie Summers in order to get your login information. Please make sure to keep your login information private.

answer.explanation: Hi, it's Susan. Are you available to meet tomorrow morning? We should get a start on hiring a manager for our new restaurant. You know, the grand opening is in two months. We have a lot of resumes to read through, so I’ll e-mail you the most promising ones now. And then, when we meet, well discuss which candidates you want to interview. Let me know if this works for you. Thanks.

question.text: What is the purpose of the message?
What does the speaker imply when she says, “the grand opening is in two months .
choices: (B) She wants the listener to reserve a room.
(C)  A project will be completed on time.
(D) A decision must be made quickly.

answer.text: (D) A decision must be made quickly.

question.text: What most likely will the speaker do next?

answer.explanation: Hello, this message is for Mr. Sam Matthews. Q2 My name is Sharon Hartford, and I’m calling from the corporate travel department. I just received your e-mail regarding the airline reservation dates and times you requested to attend the southern regional sales convention in Miami. Unfortunately, all flights are booked for the dates and times that you mentioned, but I’d be happy to help you find other flights that fit your schedule. Q3 If you can give me more information, please give me a call at 555-4141. Thank you.

question.text: What is the message mainly about?
Which most likely is Sharon Hartford?
What does the caller suggest the man do?

answer.explanation: A new study shows that Q1 workers who have reached the point in their careers when they are making the most money are surprisingly often the least content with their jobs. Q2 More money frequently comes with more responsibility, but this can result in higher stress levels and less time away from the office. The study offers several suggestions on ways to reduce stress, including shortening the time spent commuting to work and having a flexible work schedule. Q3 But the main key to happiness seems to come from spending quality time with friends and family.

question.text: What surprising trend was reported?
choices: (B) Workers are spending less time at their jobs.
(C) Many workers are not commuting to work.
(D) Workers who make the most money are the least satisfied.

answer.text: (D) Workers who make the most money are the least satisfied.

question.text: What reason is suggested for the trend?
choices: (A) Many workers prefer to live far from their jobs.
(C) Employees must take work home to finish it

question.text: What does the speaker recommend?
choices: (A) Looking for a job with fewer responsibilities
(C) Spending time with family and friends

answer.text: (C) Spending time with family and friends

answer.explanation: Hi, everyone. Q1 There have been some new regulations sent in from Head Office. Our productivity assessment was quite poor. They aren’t very happy with our performance compared to last year. Q2 So we are going to have to put in some overtime to get ahead of schedule. We really need to stay on top of this, or some people might get fired. Q3 We are going to need to make a roster and work some weekend overtime shifts. We will have a rotation list, so each staff member works one Saturday every three weeks. I know this is a burden, but once we get high enough above our targets, things will go back to normal.

question.text: According to the speaker, who is introducing the new regulations?
What does the speaker imply when she says, “We really need to stay on top of this”?
choices: (A) There is a lot of work to do.
(C) They can wait a week to start.

answer.text: (A) There is a lot of work to do.

question.text: What does the speaker tell the listeners to do on the weekends?
choices: (D) Have some time off on Saturday

answer.explanation:
Script:
W-Br: Hello. Q1 This is Wu Yifei from West Hill Auto Rental. I received your message about some problems you’re having with a car you rented from us. I apologize for the inconvenience. We inspect each car before we rent it out, and none of our techicians noticed anything wrong with the car. Now, Q2 you said that the car is making an unussual noise, and that the noise is getting louder? I’d like to arrange for someone to come out today and take a look. Q3 Please let me know when you’re available.

question.text: Where does the woman work?
Why does the woman say "None of our technicians noticed anything wrong with the car"?
choices: (A) She is confident that a product is ready to be sold.
(B) She is not sure what is causing a problem.
(C) She thinks employees need more training.
(D) She wonders if a document is accurate.

answer.text: (B) She is not sure what is causing a problem.

question.text: What does the woman ask the man to do?

answer.explanation: (M-Au): I know Q1 it's unusual to have such a large group of job applicants meet at the same time. But since we're hiring several new people who'll likely be working on the same team, we've decided to use a different process to select our future advertising staff. Before Q2 we interview you, we'll be splitting you into groups to develop an advertising campaign for a product we assign to you. We know that you won't have a lot of time — we really just want to see what you can produce, and how you work with others. Q3 Your group and product assignments are in the folders that I'll distribute now.

question.text: Who is the talk intended for?
What will listeners do in groups?
What does the speaker say he will do next?
The automotive company  _____  pursued technologies that would improve the efficiency of its engines.

answer.explanation:
Use an adverb to modify the verb "pursued"
=> Choose C

question.text: The National Overview is the fourth  ______ distributed newspaper in the northeastern region.

answer.explanation: This is the superlative form => choose an answer that is an adverb modifier for adjectives the word "distributed"

question.text: The project meeting has been rescheduled   _____  tomorrow because of the bad weather.

answer.explanation: reschedule for

question.text: The building___during the heavy thunderstorm last night.

answer.explanation: (C) The subject of the sentence, “the building”, received the action, so a passive- voice verb is required. Choices (A), (B), and (D) are all active-voice forms.

question.text: Dr. Lin, the keynote speaker at this years Southeast Dentistry Convention, _____ several groundbreaking dental devices.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: For a full refund, please ___ the product In its original packaging.

answer.explanation: This is an instruction so we use the verb in its original form.

question.text: Candidates for positions at Pereira Consulting should answer the questions on the application form as ___ as possible.

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the verb "answer" so we choose an advẻb.

question.text: In his current role in new product development for Selzern Ltd., Mr. Kumar aims for ___ in new sports equipment.

answer.explanation: Innovation in st = Development/Creativity in st

question.text: We would like to discuss this problem honestly and _____ at the next staff meeting.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words =>Choose C
Note:
- would like + to V
- discuss sth

question.text: The April edition of Fishing and More magazine looks _____different from previous issues because of the new art editor.

answer.explanation:
Need 1 Adv before Adj - modify for Adj.
=> Choose C.

question.text: While some countries have made huge investments in the Caribbean lately, others have reduced --------.

answer.explanation: their (other countries') investment = theirs

question.text: A recent ------- of restaurants across the nation suggests that people are dining out much more frequently.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: Lawton Airways has announced that it will ___ increase its nonstop service from Cransen to Hopley City.

answer.explanation: Substantially = Greatly

question.text: Those giving demonstrations at the department store _____ explained the product’s features and benefits.

answer.explanation:
Before or after the verb we use the adverb (adv)
=>Choose C

question.text: The novelist said that his writing was ______ influenced by the late writer Edward Truitt.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of adverbs => profoundly modifies best the verb "influenced"
=> Choose D

question.text: The path through Morrison Park was constructed not only for cyclists ______  joggers.

answer.explanation: You see in the sentence "not only" so it is easy to deduce that the "but also" is missing.

question.text: The Milltown Cinema’s outdoor cafe will be closed ___ the winter months.

answer.explanation: During + Period of time

question.text: ___ the new office building is occupied, construction vehicles will not be allowed to use the main parking area.

answer.explanation: Once = When

question.text: At Links Fine Meats, we pride ------- on providing the highest-quality products on the market.

answer.explanation: According to the structure "[pride] oneself on" and the main subject of the sentence is we, so in the blank, you need to fill in a corresponding reflexive pronoun (ourshelves)

question.text: Mr. Ling has ------- requested funding for airport terminal improvements.

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the current usage has completed so you can use yet or already. However, this sentence has a positive meaning so it is already selected

question.text: ------- he is usually quiet around the office, Mr. Heineman is known for his witty and engaging public speeches.

answer.explanation: It is necessary to fill in a conjunction that is suitable in meaning to connect the two clauses.

question.text: Mr, Krause will reorganize the supply room ------ the cabinets are delivered.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before a clause => B and D are wrong
"soon" as an adverb to modify for the verb so cannot be used at the beginning of the clause as in this sentence.
With the remaining 2 answers, based on the meaning, C is correct.

question.text: The train delays on the Trenton line were caused by a _____ error at one of the stations.

answer.explanation:
Before the noun is 1 adjective
=>Choose C

question.text: One of the supervisors questioned Ms.Marshall ______  her role in the misuse of the investment funds.

answer.explanation: Struture: question sb about sth

question.text: If you don’t want to get stuck in a traffic jam, you should avoid___during rush hour.

answer.explanation: (B) The verb “avoid” is followed by a gerund. Choice (A) is the base or present tense form. Choice (C) is the infinitive form. Choice (D) is the past participle.

question.text: South Regent Aviation is adopting measures to reduce fuel expenses by----cargo loads.

answer.explanation:
By + Ving
=> Choose D

question.text: The company’s new software for online banking is  _____  with most smartphone models.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose D

question.text: Because of the large number of tourists in summer months, travelers should plan ___ and make their reservations early.

answer.explanation: Accordingly = Appropriately

question.text: _____  change your seating assignment, visit the reservations page on our Web site.

answer.explanation: Infinitive with “to” at the beginning of the sentence indicating the purpose.

question.text: The  _____ of the Kawagoe factory has had a significant impact on Inagi Technology employees’ productivity.

answer.explanation: After the blank is "the", after the blank is "of" so need to fill a noun

question.text: Education Fair (9 July)-The annual International Higher Education Fair came to Jakarta for the third consecutive year on Saturday, 7 July. (1) _______. As usual, American and Australian universities were (2) ______ represented. (3) ______ , observers noted that participation from European and Asian universities has been increasing year by year. Also noticeable was the fact that many more graduate students attended the (4) ______ this year than in the past.
(9 July)-The annual International Higher Education Fair came to Jakarta for the third consecutive year on Saturday, 7 July. (1) _______.
choices: (A) A teachers’ conference was also held at the same hotel.
(B) The fair featured hundreds of institutions from all over the world.
(C) Local student organizations arranged the evening entertainment.
(D) Registration fees were waived for those who volunteered to work at the fair.

answer.text: (B) The fair featured hundreds of institutions from all over the world.
answer.explanation: The first sentence tells about the event that took place 3, logically you will have to add more information about the event, and logically with the following paragraph tells about the university => answer B. The work has been recorded attracts hundreds of educational training agencies around the world.

question.text: As usual, American and Australian universities were (2) ______ represented.

answer.explanation: Before represent verb represent adverb

question.text: (3) ______ , observers noted that participation from European and Asian universities has been increasing year by year.

answer.explanation: This sentence provides additional information from Moreover, Moreover, also is correct.

question.text: Also noticeable was the fact that many more graduate students attended the (4) ______ this year than in the past.

answer.explanation: This is an event, not class, demonstration or ceremony

question.text:
Royal Exchange Building Reborn as Hotel
Nationwide hotel operator Verdant Group____1 millions of pounds over three years converting the Royal Exchange Building on Quay street, a historical landmark, into a hotel.
"We wanted to preserve the building’s key architectural elements,” says Verdant’s CEO Gaile Edwards. “That's why we hired a group of historical experts to work with our team.” ____2.
The building retains much of its original charm as the 18th century structure and stonework remain intact. However, the building’s interior has all the____3 found at any other five-star accommodations, such as a pool and spa.
The combination of the hotel’s modern facilities with its historic appearance makes the venue a major ____4 for tourists. Already, suites are fully booked for its opening weekend, which is scheduled for late next month.

answer.explanation: Use past simple

choices: (A) It will take another year before the hotel opens its doors.
(B)This is Verdant Group’s first project that is a joint venture.
(C)Judging from the results, it seems that they were successful.
(D)Consequently, the construction firm’s initial proposal was rejected.

answer.text: (C)Judging from the results, it seems that they were successful.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.
Based on the meaning of words.
By phrase "a major attraction"

Larry Martin

Karen Johnson

question.text:
Ryke Photography
Cameras and photography supplies
www.rykephotograpliy.com


August 15

Hien Tran
324 Oak Lane
Columbus, OH 43085

Dear Ms. Tran:

Thank you for renting from Ryke Photography. The camera you ordered from us will be arriving shortly (if you have not received it already). It has been thoroughly cleaned and tested prior to shipping. We are confident that you will be pleased with it, but if you experience any problems, please let us know right away.

Our records indicate that we have sent you the following items:
•1 Manning 6100 camera (35-70 millimeter zoom lens)
•2 lens caps
•1 camera strap
•1 hard-sided case

Your rental period ends on October 15. If the above items are not returned by this date, we will charge you for the purchase of replacement items.

When returning the camera and the accessories, please pack them carefully inside the hard-sided case and insert the case in the shipping box provided. Affix the return label to the package and drop it off at your local Hart Courier office, or call 482-555¬0711 to arrange for a pickup.

Thank you again for your order.
Sincerely,
Paul Denning
Owner
What is the purpose of the letter?
choices: (A)To give instructions about returning a camera
(B)To describe how a new camera is different from earlier models
(C)To explain how to use a camera
(D)To ask for a customer's opinion about a camera

answer.text: (A)To give instructions about returning a camera
answer.explanation: Information in the sentences: "When returning the camera and the accessories, please pack them carefully inside the hard-sided case and insert the case in the shipping box provided. Affix the return label to the package and drop it off at your local Hart Courier office, or call 482-555¬0711 to arrange for a pickup."

choices: (A)Ms. Tran picked it up at Ryke Photography.
(B)Ms. Tran has reported a problem with it.

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "When returning the camera and the accessories, please pack them carefully inside the hard-sided case and insert the case in the shipping box provided."

question.text:
From: Tronica LLC Customer Service
To: Nossis Software Subscribes
Date: 14 September
Subject: Version 3.1
Dear Nossis Software Subscribers,
Later this month, Tronica LLC will release version 3.1 of Nossis, our online software for creating commercial artwork. Beginning at 11 p.m. GMT on 29 September, Nossis will be unavailable while our technicians roll out the new version. You need take no action. We will back up all portfolios containing customer files stored in our online database; thus, they will be fully protected during the process. All users will be notified on the morning of 30 September upon completion of the process. After receiving the notification, customers can resume using Nossis.
New features include a redesigned interface for streamlined workflow, innovative design themes, new backgrounds and fonts, and interactive tracking tools for markups and revisions. We are confident that you will enjoy these new features.
Sincerely,
Tronica LLC Customer Service
What is the purpose of the e-mail?
choices: (C)To explain how to use a program

answer.explanation: The article is about the company coming up with a new version for the "will release" software version ... " and guide customers on the transition => answer D

question.text: What does the e-mail indicate will happen on September 29 ?
choices: (C)An e-mail will be sent to Nossis users.
(D)New software will be made available for purchase.

answer.explanation: “Nossis will become                           unavailable .. " Immediately after the September 29 episode => immediately select answer A

question.text: The phrase “roll out” in paragraph 1, line 3, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "Roll out" means put to use => closest to the introduction

question.text:
Sliver Poseidon Cruises


Do you want to see the world? Then plan to visit the Silver Poseidon Cruises Career Fair on Tuesday, November 15 from 9 A.M. to 4 P.M. or Wednesday, November 16 from 5 P.M. to 9 P.M. We are looking for food servers, entertainers, and maintenance staff to work aboard our many vessels. Free travel is just the beginning when you work for Silver Poseidon Cruises.

We offer paid training, great benefits, and opportunities to advance. Applicants should have at least three years of related work experience as well as good communication skills and be able to work nights and holidays. For more information,
please call 1-800-555-7962
or

eruiz@silverposeidoncruises.com.

question.text:
More Buses During the Holidays

November 28- - [1] - Although the holiday season signals a nice week-long vacation for many, bus drivers will work longer hours and straight into the holidays to accommodate the many tourists that are flooding the city this time of year and the shoppers that are busy buying those last-minute gifts. - [2] - The city announced new bus schedules for the next few weeks which included some routes where the buses would run all day and all night. While most buses stop running by 1:00 A.M., some parts of downtown will see buses running all night. The Bingham shopping district will also see buses running until 3:00 A.M. “This is when we have the most tourists and out-of-town folks coming to visit,” explained Mayor Bill Nate. “We felt it was important to provide the necessary services during this time.” - [3] - When the bus drivers’ union leader, Nathan Reiner, was asked about the new schedules he responded, "We worked out a payment that is agreeable on both sides and have enough drivers that can work in shifts so that there is no danger of overworking or exhaustion. Many of US will still get some time off during the holidays with our families.” - [4] –
What is suggested about Mr. Reiner?
choices: (A) He is happy with the mayor.
(C) He seems satisfied with the working conditions.
(D) He would like some time off for the holidays

answer.text: (C) He seems satisfied with the working conditions.
answer.explanation: In his reply at the end of the article, Mr. Reiner mentioned things like “payment agreeable to both sides” (possible salary negotiable with both parties), “no danger of overworking and exhaustion” (no danger of overworking or exhaustion),… This shows Mr. Reiner's satisfaction with working conditions.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Overall, the city seems prepared for the influx of tourists and holiday shoppers as Christmas draws near.”

answer.explanation: A sentence with the word "Overall" is a sentence of general evaluation that will appear either at the beginning or at the end of the article. Here, we see that this sentence is a general assessment of the city's holiday preparations, so it is likely to appear at the end of the article after the whole article has talked about what the city does.

question.text: What is stated about the city during the holiday season?
choices: (A) It closes down for the holidays.
(B) Many visitors come from out of town,
(C) More taxi drivers lose their business.
(D) The citizens travel to other cities

answer.text: (B) Many visitors come from out of town,
answer.explanation: Information on accommodation “This is when we have the most tourists and out-of-town folks coming to visit”

question.text: What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A) To report changes in public transportation
(B) To describe the city during the holidays
(C) To inform the public about traffic delays

answer.text: (A) To report changes in public transportation
answer.explanation: The headline that says "more bus", the purpose of this article is to report changes in transport vehicles. public communication during the holiday season.

question.text:
Filiz Budak, 8:30 A.M.
Hello all, Once again when I opened up the shop earlier today, all the lights were on. Does anyone know how that happened?
Luke Ciccone, 8:33 A.M.
I set the timer right before locking the door yesterday afternoon. The lights should have shut off at 6 P.M.
Analia Rue, 8:35 A.M.
I drove by the store on my way home from the post office around 6:30, and the lights were off.
Filiz Budak, 8:37 A.M.
OK. Since this has happened the last three mornings, there's definitely a problem with the timer.
Jae Woo Han, 8:38 A.M.
I left with Luke at 5 and saw him set the timer.
Luke Ciccone, 8:42 A.M.
I agree. The lights are turning on before they are scheduled to. I'll call a repair service when I get to work for my shift. Rex Repair is always reliable.
Filiz Budak, 8:48 A.M.
Contact the company that did the installation. The paperwork should be in one of the filing cabinets. And until the timer can be fixed, the last person on duty will have to turn off each light before closing.
Jae Woo Han, 8:50 A.M.
Yes, I remember filling their invoice at the time of the installation.
Luke Ciccone, 8:51 A.M.
Will do.
What is most likely true about Ms. Budak?
choices: (A) She works in a post office.

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Once again when I opened up the shop earlier today, all the lights were on."

question.text: Who was the last person to see that the lights were off?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "I drove by the store on my way home from the post office around 6:30, and the lights were off."

question.text: At 8:42 A.M., what does Mr. Ciccone most likely mean when he writes, "I agree"?
choices: (A) He believes that the timer needs to be fixed.
(B) He plans to follow Ms. Budak's instructions.
(C) He thinks that Rex Repair is a trusted repair service.
(D) He knows that Mr. Han saw him set the timer.

answer.text: (A) He believes that the timer needs to be fixed.
answer.explanation:
"I agree" is associated with the previous sentence " Since this has happened the last three mornings, there's definitely a problem
with the timer." and the sentence "I'll call a repair
service."

question.text: What is the first thing Mr. Ciccone will most likely do when he arrives at works?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Yes, I remember filing their invoice at the time of the installation." and "Will do".

question.text:
J&P Industries

1462 Swinton street

Cameron, GL 10288

March 29
Mr. Grant Lee
287 Silver Plains Road
Cameron, GL 18729

Dear Mr. Lee,
We thank you for your continued work and your dedication to your job at J&P Industries. -[1] - We are sending all employees information about the new changes that have been made to your health insurance benefits at our company. You will continue to be covered by the same insurance company, but because of the new state regulations that have been put forth, all employees must now undergo a basic medical check-up at a local clinic or hospital. This check-up will be covered by your health insurance, so you do not need to pay any extra fees and this by no means will affect the monthly insurance deductions. -[2] - Included in the envelope is the detailed information about the new medical program for employees.
The medical check-ups will include a blood test, urine test, eye test, height and weight measurements, hearing test, and chest X-rays. - [3] - Please make an appointment with a local clinic. You should have your results given to Karen Leigh at Human Resources by December 30th at the latest. If you fail to get a medical exam, then you may be subject to a fine up to $2000. - [4] - We thank you for your cooperation and hope you abide by the new changes.
If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact Karen at leighk@jpindustries.com.

Sincerely,
John Black
Executive Manager
J&P Industries
The term “subject to” at the end of the second paragraph is closest in meaning to:

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: What is the purpose of the letter?
choices: (A) To inform an employee about a mandatory exam
(B) To encourage employees to donate blood to the hospital
(C) To discuss the changes made to the health insurance coverage
(D) To advertise the services of a new clinic

answer.text: (A) To inform an employee about a mandatory exam
answer.explanation: The content of this letter is about the medical examination the employee will undergo if will not have to pay high fines.	(B) To encourage employees to donate blood

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“The appointments should take no longer than 30 minutes.

answer.explanation: In this sentence there is mention "appointment", can be understood here as "health appointment", so it is most suitable for the position [3] after talking about what to do during the appointment.

question.text: What did Mr. Black send with the letter?

answer.explanation: Information on location “Included in the envelope is the detailed information about the new medical program for employees.”

question.text:
Mr. John Morris
1423 Bernard Avenue
Millville, CA 90117

Dear Mr. Morris,
24/7 Fitness is the most successful workout facility in the United States. With over 3 million members nationwide, our franchise has become known as a reputable and trustworthy brand. Our success is a result of great relationships between US the franchiser and our franchisees.

You are receiving this mailing because you expressed interest in partnering with 24/7 Fitness in order to open a new location in your town. According to our preliminary research, your town has a large population of young, single people working in the professional field. This is our target demographic, and it means the business outlook for your 24/7 Fitness location is positive in your town. If you would like more information about the specific terms and regulations when partnering with 24/7 Fitness, please don't hesitate to call me at 347-555-3363. Additionally, if you would like to talk to another franchise owner, that information can be supplied by one of our associates.

Sincerely,

Lori Swanson
Chief Operating Officer

==========================

To: Zack Carter - zcarter@zenmail.com
From: John Morris - jmorris@cbnet.com
Subject: 24/7 Fitness
Date: March 6

Dear Mr. Carter,
My name is John Morris and I am a small business owner living in the Millville area. I am currently in negotiations with 24/7 Fitness to open my own location here in Millville. As someone who works with 24/7 Fitness, you would help me a lot by sharing your opinions.

I am interested in how you assess 24/7 Fitness as a franchiser. I operated several franchises in the past, and I always found that trust and honesty are the most important factors in a successful relationship. More importantly, I was also wondering what kind of support is provided by the parent company. Before opening your location, did you receive adequate training to allow you to smoothly begin operating your business? Any advice you can give me would be much appreciated.

Sincerely,
John Morris

===========================

To: John Morris  - jmorris@cbnet.com
From: Zack Carter - zcarter@zenmail.com
Subject: 24/7 Fitness
Date: March 7

Dear Mr. Morris,
I am happy to provide some insight into the operation of a 24/7 Fitness franchise. I have been working with 24/7 Fitness as a franchise owner for 10 years now. I actually run three different branches now. I completely agree with you that trust and honesty are the two most important aspects of any business relationship. On that count, I believe the fact that I own three franchises is testament to my faith in the franchiser.

Let me put your mind at ease. First off, 24/7 Fitness has a very specific way that they want their brand to develop no matter who owns the branch. The parent company will not only provide training, but they insist on controlling the actual layout of the facilities from the locker rooms to the free weights. They want any of their 3 million members to be able to walk into any one of their gyms and feel at home. Until you have been operating for one full year, you must make monthly reports to corporate headquarters detailing all aspects of sales, membership, and a flow chart describing the usage of the facilities. It really is hands on until they have confidence you can represent the brand. I hope this helps you decide to join the 24/7 Fitness team!

All the best,
Zack Carter
According to the letter, what is the key to 24/7 Fitness’ success?

answer.explanation: Our success is a result of great relationships and our franchiser giữa franchisees

question.text: Where did Mr. Morris most likely get Mr. Carter’s contact information?

answer.explanation: I currently in negotiations with 24/7 Fitness to open my own location here in Millville. As someone who works with 24/7 Fitness, you would help me a lot by sharing your opinions.

question.text: What concerns Mr. Morris most about 24/7 Fitness?

answer.explanation: I was also wondering what kind of support is provided by the parent company. Before opening your location, did you receive adequate training to allow you to smoothly begin operating your business?

question.text: What is the purpose of Zack Carter’s e-mail?
choices: (A) To ask for information about a franchise
(B) To tell John Morris about 24/7 Fitness and the training they provide
(C) To persuade John Morris to avoid becoming an owner of a 24/7 Fitness franchise
(D) To remind 24/7 Fitness of their responsibility to their franchisees

answer.text: (B) To tell John Morris about 24/7 Fitness and the training they provide
answer.explanation: I am happy to provide some insight into the operation of a 24/7 Fitness franchise.

question.text: In Zack Carter’s e-mail, what is indicated about 24/7 Fitness?
choices: (A) They want all of their fitness centers to be nearly identical.
(B) They would like their franchisees to personalize their locations.
(C) They would like to sell more supplements and memberships next year.
(D) They require their franchisees to send quarterly reports about usage.

answer.text: (A) They want all of their fitness centers to be nearly identical.
answer.explanation: The parent company will not only provide training, but they insist on controlling the actual layout of the facilities from the lock rooms to the free weights.

I did not double check my order all before I left the store. When I arrived at the house I was working on, I realized I had received only one garloons of BN-101 paint I had order.
According to table: BN-101 of Coastland

... We saw the comments you posted about us on uopine.com, and we are grateful to you. It was nice to hear that our flagship location was so convenient for your worksite and that you were able to pick your missing paint there.
Additional locations: Southeast flagship store

question.text: What is indicated about Bright Now Home?
choices: (C)        It sells supplies for building maintenance.

We are glad to have served your business ...

question.text:
September 21—What is the secret to delicious home-cooked meals? Kimberly Lee, host of the My Home Cooking television show and owner of her own restaurant chain, seems to know all the secrets. Her show has been on the air for over two years, and now she has a devoted group of followers around the country. When she sat down for an interview with US, she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food.
Ms. Lee is scheduled to publish her very first cookbook near the end of the month. The book is entitled Kimberly Lee’s My Home Cooking, and it provides easy-to- follow recipes that can be made in less than 30 minutes. Over 40,000 copies have already been pre-ordered so far.
Ms. Lee says that the final page of the book will include a detachable fan club membership form. Those who fill the form out and send it in to the provided address will receive a monthly newsletter and exclusive recipes available only to those in the fan club. Fan club members will also receive a password that allows access to a fan club website.

===========================

To: Kimberly Lee-kimberlylee@kimberlylee.com
From: Suzie Sanders - suziesanders@kimberlylee.com
Date: October 12
Subject: Update

Dear Ms. Lee,
Great news! I’m happy to report that not only has your book been selling well, but the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I’m certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book.
Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month’s newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time.
Sincerely,

Suzie Sanders Publicity
Coordinator
What is the first thing to do in order to become a fan club member?

answer.explanation: At the end of the article she Lee says the last page of the book has a membership registration form. So to be able to get the registration form, the first thing to do is to buy that book.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the article?
choices: (B) To provide advice for professional chefs

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the main content of the article is about Ms. Lee and her upcoming book. So the correct answer is A.

question.text: What is suggested about next month’s newsletter?
choices: (A) It will be mailed behind schedule.
(B) It will feature a column about healthy eating habits.
(C) It will contain an article on desserts.
(D) It will include a copy of Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It will contain an article on desserts.
answer.explanation:
Derived from the last two sentences of the letter: “Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month's newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time. ”
So if they meet the members' request, next month's letter will have recipes for desserts like cakes and candies.

question.text: In the e-mail, what does Suzie Sanders say about the article?
choices: (A) It was written by a famous journalist.
(B) It was featured on a popular cooking website.
(C) It helped increase fan club membership.
(D) It contained excerpts from Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It helped increase fan club membership.
answer.explanation: The information at the beginning of the email: “the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I'm certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book. ”

question.text: Accordingto Ms. Lee, what is the secret to successful cooking?

answer.explanation: Information in the following sentence in the article “she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food”

question.text:
Tech Life Hires New CEO

New York, April 12 — Amid a crisis of low sales and disappointing performance, the technology company Tech Life has hired Steve Cross as its new chief executive officer. Previously, he was the chief financial officer at the technology investment firm Esta Resources in San Francisco, California. He assumed the position of CEO at the company—based in Dallas, Texas—just this Monday. Stockholders voted unanimously for the appointment, hoping the new CEO will bring renewed vitality and strength to the company. Mr. Cross has an impressive record as a business leader who makes smart decisions," commented Lynn Dyer, the director of human resources at Tech Life. "We have faith that he will lead US in a new direction that will help develop new markets and optimize our company operations in general."
Steve Cross graduated from Chester University in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, with a master's degree in business administration. He once served as head of the American League of Business Leaders and is a dedicated family man.

===========================

To:Steve Cross- scross@techlife.com
From:Lynn Dyer - ldyer@techlife.com
Subject: Welcome!
Date:April 15
Dear Mr. Cross,

It has been almost two years since we met. I am so glad to be collaborating with you again after we worked in the same department at Esta Resources. I felt we cooperated very well at that time, and I had been hoping to work with you again. You will find that we have very dedicated and hard-working teams here. If there is anything I can do to help you make the transition, please don’t hesitate to ask.
Additionally, Tech Life has recently added five new managers to our company. If you have time, please visit them when they will all be attending a mandatory training session at 3:00 RM. this afternoon in Room 403.

Sincerely,
Lynn Dyer
Director of Human Resources Tech Life
What problem is Tech Life facing?

answer.explanation: “Amid a crisis of low sales and disappointing performance ”

question.text: What is mentioned about the shareholders?
choices: (A) They are allowed to share financial information.
(B) They will hold a meeting next week.
(D) They agreed on the appointment of a new leader.

answer.text: (D) They agreed on the appointment of a new leader.
answer.explanation: “Stockholders voted unanimously for the appointment, hoping the new CEO will bring renewed vitality and strength to the company”

question.text: In the article, the word “optimize” in paragraph 2, line 6, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: End of paragraph 2: "... optimize our company operations in general"

question.text: Where did Ms. Dyer work previously?

answer.explanation:
* In the article: he (Steve Cross) was the chief financial officer at... Esta Resources in San Francisco, California.
Steve Cross is CFO at... Esta Resources in San Francisco, California.

In the email: we worked in the same department at Esta Resources CFO at... Esta Resources in San Francisco, California.

question.text: What is Mr. Cross asked to do?

answer.explanation: In the email, paragraph 2: If you have time, please visit them (new managers) when they will all be attending a mandatory training session at 3:00 PM...

question.text:
Quipwerx Support Request Form
Complete and submit this form to create a support ticket number. We will e-mail you a response within 24 hours.
Name: Agnes Kowalsi
Company: Alexsy Corportation
E-mail Address: akowalski@alexsycorp.net
Subject: Web-conferencing issues
Please describe the problem you are experiencing.
We started using your Web-conferencing software in June and have been pleased with it overall. Yesterday, however, we had several interruptions in service during an important training session. In the middle of our meeting, the screen suddenly went black and a notice appeared stating, “Quipwerx is down for maintenance.” Several employees were calling in from overseas, and after this notice appeared multiple times, we decided to reschedule. Is there a way for you to inform us of your maintenance schedule in advance? If not, I will probably terminate my membership. I must be confident that I can use your product anytime I need it.
======================
To: Agnes Kowalski - akowalski@alexsycorp.net
From: Quipwerx Support - support@quipwerxsoftware.com
Date: July 29
Subject: Ticket: 000125659 –Web Conferencing Issues
Dear Ms. Kowalski,
Thank you for contacting us with your concerns. The issue you had this past Wednesday was caused by servers that crashed due to a database communication issue. We could not anticipate this problem, so we were unable to warn customers in advance. I assure you that this type of occurrence is very rare.
In light of your comments, we have decided to reword our alert message from “down for maintenance” to “experiencing technical difficulties.” That way customers will know the problem is due to unforeseen circumstances rather than routine maintenance. As a matter of fact, our software is hardly ever down for maintenance. When we work on an upgrade, the software is unavailable for just a few minutes, if at all.
We regret the inconvenience this has caused you and are truly grateful for your feedback. In appreciation of your business, we will be waiving the service fee on your company account for this month.
Sincerely,
Cindy Trautman,
Quipwerx Support
What does Ms. Kowalski request on the online form?
choices: (D)A new time for a training session

answer.explanation: The article mentions the phrase "down for maintenance" and she is explaining the problem she is having and asking for information about the "inform about maintenance schedule".

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Kowalski ?

answer.explanation: The whole paragraph in the form section states that she uses the software for 'training => only answer C is reasonable.

question.text: What is Ms. Kowalski's complaint regarding Quipwerx conferencing software?
choices: (A)It does not serve her current purposes.
(D)It cannot be used by her overseas clients.

answer.explanation: Because she had the problem "had several interruptions" she thought the software was unreliable and terminate my membership.

question.text: What does Ms. Trautman say Ouipwerx will change?

answer.explanation: In the response message saying "decide to reword our alert message" means to decide to change the notification message.

question.text: What is indicated about Alexsy Corporation?
choices: (D)It pays a monthly fee to Ouipwerx.

answer.text: (D)It pays a monthly fee to Ouipwerx.
answer.explanation: Due to the problem above, Quipwerx company will refund this month fee (will be waiving the service fee on your company ...) => Alexsy company needs to pay monthly fee => answer D
